text.p: Merrill Lynch said it initiated coverage of Brazil's Confab Industrial, a manufacturer of welded steel pipes and capital goods, with an accumulate rating in the intermediate term.

-- In a report, the securities firm said the rating reflected Confab Industrial's attractive valuation and a belief that a suitable price objective was 2.15 reais to 2.25 reais per share over the intermediate term. That represents a 28 percent to 34 percent appreciation.
-- Confab's preferred shares were off 0.58 percent at 1.72 reais late Thursday on the Sao Paulo bourse.

-- Confab Industrial owns 70 percent of Confab Tubos, a manufacturer of welded steel pipes, with annual installed production capacity of 500,000 tonnes per annum, Merrill Lynch said. The pipe company has a dominant position in the Brazilian market and robust export program, it added.
-- Confab Industrial's capital goods division produces special order equipment such as storage tanks, pressure spheres and industrial boilers, Merrill Lynch said.

-- "Currently demand is not strong, and we do not expect the capital goods division to contribute to profits in any significant way over the next two years, although opportunities do abound in the future," the report said.
